critique: The executive order aims to evoke a sense of hope and relief by addressing the issues with the current healthcare system. It highlights the problems with the Affordable Care Act (PPACA) and proposes solutions to increase choice and affordability. The order also seeks to convey a sense of confidence in the administration's ability to improve the healthcare system. The primary emotions the president wants to convey are joy and surprise. Joy because the executive order is intended to make people feel happy about the changes to the healthcare system. Surprise because the executive order is intended to make people feel surprised about the changes to the healthcare system.
